result.execSummary:
The defendant David C Ranft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Any current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety. Comply with random urine screens. No use or possession of alcohol or drug paraphernalia or drugs without a valid prescription. Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week.
Court Costs were waived. DNA Surcharge and sample were waived.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

dated 12/1/16 from Department of Corrections requesting clarification regarding DNA surcharges
**Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 12/7/16-The court has the authority to waive costs where it believes it to be appropriate.  Therefor, no further action will be taken concerning the DNA surcharge on this case.**

(3) character letters filed
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
(2) filed

Defendant David C Ranft in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 18, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant David C Ranft in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defense was expecting a different charge on the Amended Information.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the parties to come to an agreement.  Court returns the Amended Information to the State and the change of plea paperwork to the Defense.  Defendant to be produced for the next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
